answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I have found some sample RFPs that you might find helpful.
The following are RFPs for EMS Medical Billing.
Hernando County, FL
http://www.co.hernando.fl.us/pur/pdfnob/6-078RFP.pdf
Scarborough, ME
http://www.scarborough.me.us/purchasing/open/rfpemsbilling.pdf
Easton, MA
http://www.easton.ma.us/Directory/Notices/RFQs/Ambulance_Billing_Collection_RFP_FY2012_2014.pdf
This one from the City of North Las Vegas is for consulting purposes.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/13036
I also included a sample RFP from the City of Deltona, FL for a Cost Efficiency Consultant.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14779/RFP__Cost_Efficiency_Consultant
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

answers.author: Kirk Buffington
answers.text:
I will provide two RFPs done by the City.  (i think i can only attach one to each posted answer) one is for a consultant to assist in the assessment of our Fire-EMS fee, and the other is for the retaining of a billing company.  (much of what you do with billing is going to dictated by state regulations and your billing software)

author: Adam Carpenetti
text: I am getting ready to write an RFI, and eventually an RFP, to obtain the services of a billing company or consultant to help us move towards a fee for service for EMS.  We currently do not charge for these services.  We have a small committee that is working on this plan and we have some differing opinions of what a billing company or consultant will do to help us implement the project.  This is the purpose of starting with an RFI.  Any information or documents would be greatly appreciated.
title: RFI/RFP - EMS Fee for Service/Revenue Recovery
